verses.text: The \w words|strong="H1697"\w* of \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w Lemuel|strong="H3927"\w*, the \w prophecy|strong="H4853"\w* that his \w mother|strong="H0517"\w* \w taught|strong="H3256"\w* him.
What, my \w son|strong="H1248"\w*? and what, the \w son|strong="H1248"\w* of my \w womb|strong="H0990"\w*? and what, the \w son|strong="H1248"\w* of my \w vows|strong="H5088"\w*?

\w Give|strong="H5414"\w* not thy \w strength|strong="H2428"\w* unto \w women|strong="H0802"\w*, nor thy \w ways|strong="H1870"\w* to that which \w destroyeth|strong="H4229"\w* \w kings|strong="H4428"\w*.

\add It is\add* not for \w kings|strong="H4428"\w*, O \w Lemuel|strong="H3927"\w*, \add it is\add* not for \w kings|strong="H4428"\w* to \w drink|strong="H8354"\w* \w wine|strong="H3196"\w*; nor \w for|strong="H0335"\w* \w princes|strong="H7336"\w* strong \w drink|strong="H7941"\w*:

Lest they \w drink|strong="H8354"\w*, and \w forget|strong="H7911"\w* the \w law|strong="H2710"\w*, and \w pervert|strong="H8138"\w* the \w judgment|strong="H1779"\w* of any of the \w afflicted|strong="H1121"\w*.\f + \fr 31.5 \ft pervert: Heb. alter\f*\f + \fr 31.5 \ft of any…: Heb. of all the sons of affliction\f*

\w Give|strong="H5414"\w* strong \w drink|strong="H7941"\w* unto him that is ready to \w perish|strong="H0006"\w*, and \w wine|strong="H3196"\w* unto those that be of \w heavy|strong="H4751"\w* \w hearts|strong="H5315"\w*.\f + \fr 31.6 \ft of…: Heb. bitter of soul\f*
Let him \w drink|strong="H8354"\w*, and \w forget|strong="H7911"\w* his \w poverty|strong="H7389"\w*, and \w remember|strong="H2142"\w* his \w misery|strong="H5999"\w* no more.

\w Open|strong="H6605"\w* thy \w mouth|strong="H6310"\w* for the \w dumb|strong="H0483"\w* in the \w cause|strong="H1779"\w* of all such as are \w appointed|strong="H1121"\w* to \w destruction|strong="H2475"\w*.\f + \fr 31.8 \ft such…: Heb. the sons of destruction\f*

\w Open|strong="H6605"\w* thy \w mouth|strong="H6310"\w*, \w judge|strong="H8199"\w* \w righteously|strong="H6664"\w*, and \w plead|strong="H1777"\w* the cause of the \w poor|strong="H6041"\w* and \w needy|strong="H0034"\w*.

¶ Who can \w find|strong="H4672"\w* a \w virtuous|strong="H2428"\w* \w woman|strong="H0802"\w*? for her \w price|strong="H4377"\w* \add is\add* \w far|strong="H7350"\w* above \w rubies|strong="H6443"\w*.
The \w heart|strong="H3820"\w* of her \w husband|strong="H1167"\w* doth safely \w trust|strong="H0982"\w* in her, so that he shall have no \w need|strong="H2637"\w* of \w spoil|strong="H7998"\w*.
She will \w do|strong="H1580"\w* him \w good|strong="H2896"\w* and not \w evil|strong="H7451"\w* all the \w days|strong="H3117"\w* of her \w life|strong="H2416"\w*.
She \w seeketh|strong="H1875"\w* \w wool|strong="H6785"\w*, and \w flax|strong="H6593"\w*, and \w worketh|strong="H6213"\w* \w willingly|strong="H2656"\w* with her \w hands|strong="H3709"\w*.
She is like the \w merchants’|strong="H5503"\w* \w ships|strong="H0591"\w*; she \w bringeth|strong="H0935"\w* her \w food|strong="H3899"\w* from \w afar|strong="H4801"\w*.

She \w riseth|strong="H6965"\w* also while it is yet \w night|strong="H3915"\w*, and \w giveth|strong="H5414"\w* \w meat|strong="H2964"\w* to her \w household|strong="H1004"\w*, and a \w portion|strong="H2706"\w* to her \w maidens|strong="H5291"\w*.

She \w considereth|strong="H2161"\w* a \w field|strong="H7704"\w*, and \w buyeth|strong="H3947"\w* it: with the \w fruit|strong="H6529"\w* of her \w hands|strong="H3709"\w* she \w planteth|strong="H5193"\w* a \w vineyard|strong="H3754"\w*.\f + \fr 31.16 \ft buyeth: Heb. taketh\f*
She \w girdeth|strong="H2296"\w* her \w loins|strong="H4975"\w* with \w strength|strong="H5797"\w*, and \w strengtheneth|strong="H0553"\w* her \w arms|strong="H2220"\w*.

She \w perceiveth|strong="H2938"\w* that her \w merchandise|strong="H5504"\w* \add is\add* \w good|strong="H2896"\w*: her \w candle|strong="H5216"\w* goeth not \w out|strong="H3518"\w* by \w night|strong="H3915"\w*.\f + \fr 31.18 \ft She…: Heb. She tasteth\f*
She \w layeth|strong="H7971"\w* her \w hands|strong="H3027"\w* to the \w spindle|strong="H3601"\w*, and her \w hands|strong="H3709"\w* \w hold|strong="H8551"\w* the \w distaff|strong="H6418"\w*.

She stretcheth \w out|strong="H6566"\w* her \w hand|strong="H3709"\w* to the \w poor|strong="H6041"\w*; yea, she reacheth \w forth|strong="H7971"\w* her \w hands|strong="H3027"\w* to the \w needy|strong="H0034"\w*.\f + \fr 31.20 \ft She…: Heb. She spreadeth\f*

She is not \w afraid|strong="H3372"\w* of the \w snow|strong="H7950"\w* for her \w household|strong="H1004"\w*: for all her \w household|strong="H1004"\w* \add are\add* \w clothed|strong="H3847"\w* with \w scarlet|strong="H8144"\w*.\f + \fr 31.21 \ft scarlet: or, double garments\f*
She \w maketh|strong="H6213"\w* herself coverings of \w tapestry|strong="H4765"\w*; her \w clothing|strong="H3830"\w* \add is\add* \w silk|strong="H8336"\w* and \w purple|strong="H0713"\w*.

Her \w husband|strong="H1167"\w* is \w known|strong="H3045"\w* in the \w gates|strong="H8179"\w*, when he \w sitteth|strong="H3427"\w* among the \w elders|strong="H2205"\w* of the \w land|strong="H0776"\w*.

She \w maketh|strong="H6213"\w* fine \w linen|strong="H5466"\w*, and \w selleth|strong="H4376"\w* \add it;\add* and \w delivereth|strong="H5414"\w* \w girdles|strong="H2289"\w* unto the \w merchant|strong="H3669"\w*.

\w Strength|strong="H5797"\w* and \w honour|strong="H1926"\w* \add are\add* her \w clothing|strong="H3830"\w*; and she shall \w rejoice|strong="H7832"\w* in \w time|strong="H3117"\w* to \w come|strong="H0314"\w*.

She \w openeth|strong="H6605"\w* her \w mouth|strong="H6310"\w* with \w wisdom|strong="H2451"\w*; and in her \w tongue|strong="H3956"\w* \add is\add* the \w law|strong="H8451"\w* of \w kindness|strong="H2617"\w*.

She looketh \w well|strong="H6822"\w* to the \w ways|strong="H1979"\w* of her \w household|strong="H1004"\w*, and \w eateth|strong="H0398"\w* not the \w bread|strong="H3899"\w* of \w idleness|strong="H6104"\w*.
Her \w children|strong="H1121"\w* arise \w up|strong="H6965"\w*, and call her \w blessed|strong="H0833"\w*; her \w husband|strong="H1167"\w* \add also\add*, and he \w praiseth|strong="H1984"\w* her.

\w Many|strong="H7227"\w* \w daughters|strong="H1323"\w* have \w done|strong="H6213"\w* \w virtuously|strong="H2428"\w*, but thou \w excellest|strong="H5927"\w* them all.\f + \fr 31.29 \ft have…: or, have gotten riches\f*

\w Favour|strong="H2580"\w* \add is\add* \w deceitful|strong="H8267"\w*, and \w beauty|strong="H3308"\w* \add is\add* \w vain|strong="H1892"\w*: \add but\add* a \w woman|strong="H0802"\w* \add that\add* \w feareth|strong="H3373"\w* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, she shall be \w praised|strong="H1984"\w*.

\w Give|strong="H5414"\w* her of the \w fruit|strong="H6529"\w* of her \w hands|strong="H3027"\w*; and let her own \w works|strong="H4639"\w* \w praise|strong="H1984"\w* her in the \w gates|strong="H8179"\w*.
